content.description:
Start below a very small overlap.   Climb up to the overlap and pass it with a long reach and poor feet. 
  
 You'll know you have the climb in the back when the large flake hold is reached.  
  
 From the flake climb up with little drama to the anchors.

left side of wall.
5 bolts and chain anchors

A contender for one of the best climbs here. 
  
 Climb directly up the right side of the smooth wall on sustained crimpy holds. 
  
 The crux is in the upper half, so hopefully you have your fingertips warmed up my then.

Middle of the sector
4 bolts and rappel anchors.

Climb up a protruding mini buttress passing the first 2 bolts.   Get established on the wall proper, and continue up making a tricky 4th clip then up to better holds above the clip. 
  
 Finish more easily above via a shallow right facing groove.

Left most route.   Starts right of a large right facing corner.
5 bolts and chain anchor

Start below the obvious left facing triangular sections of rock.   Climb up to the first of these and then follow them to their end, then move straight on up the wall above.

Right side of area
4 bolts and chain anchors

Climb up the smooth face using small but good crimps a few feet to the left of the broken corner. 
  
 More or less straight up the wall, with a mantle move at around mid-hight.

Right side of area
5 bolts to chain anchors

This is the section of wall that you first come to as you walk up the approach path.   You could stay here for a good while (we did), and tick of the routes here as the perfect warm up for more of the same on either side of this wall. 
  
 The climbs range slightly in grade, but they all basically climb the same on good rock.   The holds are small but they never feel too hard so this is a good place to introduce yourself to the climbing style of the area.
